Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Thoracolumbosacral Orthoses with Abdominal Cutout on Pulmonary Function

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to wear a custom-molded TLSO with a reattachable abdominal cutout.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to wear a custom-molded TLSO with a reattachable abdominal cutout.

Objective.evidence: This study investigates whether an abdominal cutout in TLSOs improves pulmonary function in healthy adults.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was pulmonary function, assessed by forced vital capacity (FVC) and forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) at rest and after exercise.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment ensured.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group assignments.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The abdominal cutout (open) increased FVC at rest (95% CI, 3.79–4.76; p = 0.007) and postexercise (95% CI, 3.80–4.73; p = 0.025) compared with the closed TLSO.

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported during the study.
